title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:02 <@cjdelisle> requirements for what?  
00:02 <Dan18> software requirements  
00:02 <@cjdelisle> so like a survey?  
00:02 <Dan18> like a requirements management tool  
00:09 <@cjdelisle> I don't know of any but xwiki is pretty flexable.  
00:09 <@cjdelisle> case in point, the registration page is handled entirely in script  
00:09 <@cjdelisle> so is the invitation application  
00:11 <Dan18> yes, i'd like to gather and manage requirements using xwiki, and hoped that something already exists to get a head start ...  
00:11 <Dan18> the flexibility is exactly why i like xwiki so much  
00:11 <@cjdelisle> Nothing I know of  
00:15 <Dan18> ok, thanks  
00:23 <Dan18> has quit  
00:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
00:29 <tmortagne> has left #xwiki  
00:50 <abusenius\_> has quit  
00:52 <sburjan`> has quit  
05:33 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
05:40 <DrLou> has quit  
07:08 <Dan18> has joined #xwiki  
07:08 <Dan18> hello  
07:08 <Dan18> i just installed the php macro  
07:10 <Dan18> and to install the gliffy client lib i need to know the php include path  
07:11 <Dan18> any idea where these are located  
07:20 <Dan18> in particular the client lib php files and the config.php file need to be in in the php include path  
07:20 <Dan18> hmm perhaps running the info thingy could reveal it  
07:23 <Dan18> nope, not that i can tell  
07:23 <Dan18> its not in the infophp output  
07:33 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
07:36 <Dan18> Hi rr  
08:00 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:00 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
08:04 <rrodriguez> has quit  
08:08 <Dan18> has quit  
08:11 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <vmassol> has quit  
08:25 <Dan18> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <Dan18> Hello  
08:26 <Dan18> hi cjdelisle  
08:29 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <Dan18> Hi vmassol  
08:31 <vmassol> hi  
08:31 <Dan18> perhaps a quick question  
08:31 <Dan18> i just installed the php macro  
08:32 <Dan18> and want need to put the gliffy client libraries into the php include path  
08:32 <Dan18> but am not sure how the php include path is defined; what directories are included  
08:33 <vmassol> I have no clue how php works, never used it, sorry. I haven't written this macro either. It's been contributed by someone  
08:33 <Dan18> i see  
08:33 <vmassol> you could check the resin quercus docs  
08:33 <vmassol> since that's what is used  
08:33 <vmassol> you could also check the php macro sources  
08:33 <Dan18> is it possible to do scripting with java  
08:33 <Dan18> ok  
08:34 <Dan18> will take a look, i have used php before, but am not proficient in it  
08:34 <+tmortagne> you will not find anything in xwiki side sources since that's a JSR 223  
08:34 <vmassol> actually we're using jsr223 to plug into it  
08:35 <vmassol> but you may find something in quercus's docs  
08:35 <+tmortagne> so best is to ask quercus guys I guess  
08:35 <+tmortagne> since they provide the JSR 223 engine  
08:35 <+tmortagne> AFAIK  
08:35 <+tmortagne> let me check to be sure  
08:36 <+tmortagne> yep that's it our macro is just a sortcut  
08:36 <Dan18> the other option is to use gliffys java client library, but i haven't seen java in the list of scripts supported  
08:36 <+tmortagne> is ruby or python suported ?  
08:37 <+tmortagne> I think python and ruby macros should work a lot better than php one  
08:37 <Dan18> Gliffy has a rest api  
08:37 <+tmortagne> ruby at least, pythong one is a bit slow  
08:37 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <Dan18> and then two client libs to make life easier  
08:37 <Dan18> for php and java  
08:38 <+tmortagne> so you can use java one with groovy scripting  
08:38 <+tmortagne> which is what is workking the best after velocity  
08:39 <Dan18> right, i am trying to use, at least initially, those languages, i have some experience with, to ease the learning curve -- so java and php, would be useful,  
08:39 <Dan18> (mostly in recent times i programmed in vb.net)  
08:40 <Dan18> i understand that velocity is associated with java -- its the templating system to decouple code from presentation -- is this right?  
08:40 <Dan18> in an apache environment  
08:41 <+tmortagne> yep velocity and groovy are highly java oriented  
08:41 <vmassol> xwiki is highly java oriented :)  
08:41 <+tmortagne> but it's not THE templating system, just one of the many ;)  
08:41 <Dan18> i guess velocity is the scripting language of choice for xwiki  
08:41 <vmassol> yes  
08:41 <+tmortagne> yep  
08:41 <vmassol> it's the easiest one  
08:41 <Dan18> is there a good velocity tutorial out there  
08:41 <+tmortagne> but it's mostly for security reasons actually  
08:42 <vmassol> just 5-10 commands to know and you're st  
08:42 <vmassol> s/st/set/  
08:42 <+tmortagne> groovy would be great to use but it's way too powerfull so we limit it onlty to some super admin users  
08:43 <vmassol> velocity is as powerful but we run it in a sandbox (which is harder to do for groovy)  
08:44 <vmassol> Dan18: re tutorial yes  
08:44 <vmassol> trying to get you the url but either xwiki.org is slow or it's my connection  
08:44 <Dan18> thanks  
08:45 <vmassol> yuo can check out the dev guid  
08:45 <vmassol> guide  
08:45 <vmassol> there's a scripting section  
08:45 <sburjan`> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <vmassol> is xwiki.org responding for you guys?  
08:45 <+sburjan`> yes, it's working for me  
08:45 <+tmortagne> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
08:45 <vmassol> yep got it now  
08:45 <+tmortagne> yep working well  
08:45 <vmassol> thanks tmortagne  
08:46 <finbrein> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <Dan18> thanks, yes, i have looked at the guide  
08:48 <Dan18> just was wondering if there is something velocity specific out there  
08:48 <Dan18> a quick introduction and perhaps also a reference manual of sort  
08:49 <+tmortagne> http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html is a good reference  
08:49 <+tmortagne> you have the whole velocity syntax in one page  
08:50 <+tmortagne> then for XWiki you have some objects to know listed in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Script+Macro#HBindings  
08:51 <vmassol> "just was wondering if there is something velocity specific out there", check the xwiki page tmortagne gave you, there's a link to velocity user guide there  
08:51 <Dan18> thats great. thanks.  
08:51 <Dan18> btw, the submitting get\_include\_path doesnt yield any results  
08:52 <Dan18> its empty  
08:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: I think the reason the archetype doesn't work is probably because of https in https://raw.github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-archetypes/xwiki-platform-tool-archetype-component/archetype-catalog.xml  
08:52 <vmassol> this pages lists supported protocols: http://maven.apache.org/archetype/maven-archetype-plugin/generate-mojo.html  
08:52 <vmassol> checking their jiras now  
08:53 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is no http access ?  
08:53 <+tmortagne> does not seems so  
08:53 <vmassol> got it: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/ARCHETYPE-220  
08:54 <vmassol> the http protocol on github redirects to https  
08:54 <+tmortagne> "Unresolved"...  
09:05 <tmortagne> has quit  
09:08 <Enygma`> has quit  
09:13 <Dan18> ok, i think i know what the include path is  
09:13 <Dan18> its "."  
09:14 <Dan18> i guess it means that i just add the library files as attachements to the page  
09:14 <Dan18> and hopefully, they are then found when included  
09:14 <vmassol> that's a lot of wishful thinking but it's nice if it works :)  
09:17 <Dan18> where do you think the dot would point to ?  
09:18 <Dan18> (yes i am an optimist :-), but the "system" will prove me right or wrong quite quickly ...  
09:18 <vmassol> indeed

13:48 <finbrein> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:54 <+lucaa> hi devs  
13:55 <+lucaa> any idea why the property pretty name is being velocity evaluated in https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-administration/src/main/resources/XWiki/ConfigurableClassMacros.xml on line 242?  
13:55 <+lucaa> when being displayed in the generated administration section done with ConfigurableClass  
13:55 <+lucaa> cjdelisle: ?  
13:59 <Dan18> has joined #xwiki  
13:59 <Dan18> hello  
14:00 <Dan18> i am want to try using the gliffy java client with velocity; the java client comes with 8 jar libs  
14:00 <Dan18> how do i best refrence them?  
14:00 <Dan18> is there a classpath dir i can just dump the in ...  
14:03 <+lucaa> well, you need to drop those in classpath (the WEB-INF/lib under your server's webapps/xwiki ), but that won't be enough to be able to access them from velocity.  
14:03 <Dan18> ok ...  
14:03 <Dan18> what else would be needed  
14:03 <+lucaa> in order to make them accessible from velocity you need to add some of them to the velocity context. You can learn here how you can do that:  
14:03 <+lucaa> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/WritingComponents#HFromwikipages  
14:04 <+lucaa> for the API of a component  
14:04 <+lucaa> that document explains what are the steps to take to write a component  
14:04 <Dan18> is velocity scripting not an option?  
14:04 <+lucaa> wdym?  
14:05 <+lucaa> it is, the way I see it you need to write a wrapper which is an xwiki component to expose the APIs that you need from that lib to the velocity context  
14:06 <Dan18> i cant access a client "jar" lib directy from a velocity script?  
14:06 <+lucaa> no  
14:07 <+lucaa> you can from a groovy script though  
14:07 <+lucaa> because in velocity you cannot instantiate a class nor access statics  
14:07 <+lucaa> in groovy you can  
14:08 <+lucaa> see here more info http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
14:10 <Dan18> btw, are you familiar with php scripting  
14:10 <+lucaa> Dan18: no, I'm not...  
14:10 <+lucaa> sorry  
14:10 <Dan18> ok  
14:11 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:11 <Dan18> how would you approach integrating gliffy in xwiki ...  
14:11 <Dan18> would you go the component route  
14:11 <Dan18> and then use velocity  
14:11 <Dan18> ?  
14:13 <+lucaa> well, your component would be just a facade in this case  
14:13 <+lucaa> so that's not really complicated  
14:13 <Dan18> right, but i guess it would need to deal with instantiations also  
14:13 <+lucaa> as for integration, I need to see what the usecases are...  
14:14 <+lucaa> (I first need to see exactly what gliffy would be used for in xwiki to see what kind of API I would create. it could also be a macro)  
14:14 <+lucaa> whcih can be interesting  
14:15 <Dan18> i see, i think you are right  
14:15 <mflorea> has quit  
14:15 <Dan18> i was working more bottom up since i still need to learn the technology itself  
14:15 <Dan18> -- i.e. xwiki, macro, scripting, components, etc.  
14:16 <Dan18> but eventually i would hit the top and start thinking usecases  
14:18 <Dan18> a macro would probably wrap most of the functionality -- including a macro would include a Gliffy diagram, which can be "opened" in a new browser window to work on the diagram  
14:18 <Dan18> when the diagram is closed, then an image of the diagram is pulled back to the xwiki page  
14:19 <Dan18> but there is more, since gliffy supports versioning as well as handling several diagrams in folders  
14:22 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:26 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <Dan18> back  
14:31 <mflorea> has quit  
14:32 <Dan18> what about python, can it work directly jars  
14:34 <mpaun> has quit  
14:35 <@cjdelisle> lucaa: It's there so that you could do translation on the field.  
14:36 <@cjdelisle> Safari 5.0.5 SVG Remote Code Execution Exploit (DEP bypass) - [CVE: 2011-0222]:  http://bit.ly/q1AwHC <-- ouch  
14:38 <+lucaa> you can do translation on the class field names, there's a convention for that with the message tool which is handled automatically by the displayPrettyName  
14:39 <+lucaa> unfortunately it's not too documented, this feature  
14:39 <@cjdelisle> AFAIK it's broken too  
14:40 <+lucaa> I used it for annotations, it works fine  
14:40 <+lucaa> the pb is you can have issues with stuff which might be invalid velocity sintactically speaking  
14:41 <+lucaa> and that field has never meant velocity code, ever, in xwiki, afaik  
14:41 <+lucaa> I mean semantically speaking  
14:41 <Dan18> has quit  
14:41 <@cjdelisle> I made it with the assumption that you controlled the pretty names of all the fields in your classes.  
14:42 <+lucaa> the mechanism to answer the translation need is the one that I explained above, and if it's not working it needs to be fixed not reinvented a new one which can cause other problems  
14:42 <+lucaa> that's how I see this issue  
14:42 <+lucaa> so I think that evaluate in there is wrong  
14:43 <+lucaa> as for control over pretty names, you don't always  
14:43 <@cjdelisle> You can propose changing it, it is an api break but if it makes enough sense with pretty name translation working.  
14:43 <+lucaa> e.g. my case was the default configurable class and a .xar of an xwiki application  
14:44 <+lucaa> they exploded together and I didn't really have control over one or the other  
14:44 <+lucaa> only because a prop pretty name was, by mistake, invalid velocity syntax  
14:44 <+lucaa> (and a stupid velocity bug that fails parsing when the source ends in a # or $)  
14:46 <@cjdelisle> Well, I'm sorry you ran in to trouble, it's something that could be changed I suppose, perhaps we could add a field for version number so that applications in the wold with the old version are not broken (if there are any such things)  
14:46 <mpaun> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <@cjdelisle> \*wild

16:31 <Dan18> Hi  
16:32 <Dan18> i'd like to include at the bottom of a table that summarises all annotations i have made, including exteded properties i added  
16:32 <cjdelisle> has quit  
16:32 <Dan18> i looked at the query guide, but its not clear to me  
16:33 <Dan18> to get started i tried a very simple select statement as follows  
16:33 <Dan18>  {{velocity}} $services.query.xwql(select AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass).execute() {{/velocity}}  
16:34 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
16:34 <Dan18> hi cjdelisle  
16:35 <@cjdelisle> howdy  
16:36 <Dan18> brb  
16:37 <@cjdelisle> probably not a good time to ask me questions since it's time for my morning dsl failure.  
16:37 <Dan18> brb again  
16:38 <arkub> has quit  
16:41 <cjdelisle> has quit  
16:42 <Dan18> i want to create a table summarising annotations and custom properties i added  
16:42 <Dan18> i looked at the query guide but its not clear to me from there how to construct a query  
16:42 <Dan18>  {{velocity}} $services.query.xwql(select AnnotationCode.AnnotationClass).execute() {{/velocity}}  
16:43 <Dan18> thats a first attempt, which wasnt successful

16:44 <Dan18> are you back ...
